hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Distance Carbon Trekking Poles online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These are definitely light, but I’ve now broken two poles and a tip during three separate training sessions. The first break was my fault - slipped on a descent and put all my dynamic weight on the pole which ended up snapping in two places. Then, on another run, the tip broke from getting wedged between two roots - which is not uncommon - so I was surprised that this led to breakage. I was able to buy and replace the tip, so I wasn’t that concerned. Then today I stumbled on a fairly flat trail and put a little extra weight on the pole which then snapped. That one really surprised me and made me think that these are just not sturdy enough for me. I’m 6”2, 195lb and was a x-c ski racer, so I’m not a novice with poles. But - maybe I’m just too big for these? Love running with poles and love how light these are - but I’m probably going to have to look at something else, unfortunately.
review.name: Too Light?

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, great design. Excited to have these out in the mountauns
review.name: Awesome poles

review.reviewBody: I love these poles for ultra running. They are very light and comfortable to use.
review.name: Running poles

review.reviewBody: Designed by, and made for, butterflies, these poles are extremely lightweight. So far, they appear to be plenty sturdy, considering their use as intended. I calculate that, in certain terrain, using poles is 15% more efficient going up, and for the downhill it's like having a couple of shots of glucosamine at the ready.
review.name: Made for butterflies.

review.reviewBody: These fixed length carbon poles weight not much more than a leaf. I’ve run several 50 K ultras with poles (and wouldn’t think about not having them) and never pack them away- I just hold them on segments where I don’t use poles. There is no value inThe extra weight of having them adjustable.
review.name: Ridiculously light

review.reviewBody: These are my first trekking poles, and I'm amazed at how light they are, yet stable and sturdy feeling. I have to get used to running with them, but so far I like them!
review.name: So light!

review.reviewBody: Super light but still feel great in the hands. Perfect for trail running.
review.name: Simple and light

review.reviewBody: Amazingly light and strong. Never have I ever actually folded my poles during a trail race, so the weight savings and reduced failure points compared to the trifold system are great.
review.name: Serious poles

review.reviewBody: Hard to believe how light these poles are! Surprisingly thin and still feel very solid, minimal flex. Very useful ring feature at the balance point for when carrying the poles.
review.name: Ultralight, Very solid, Great Features

review.reviewBody: I have both the FLZ and these and I cannot believe how light these are. The entire pair weighs less than my cell phone!
review.name: Super light poles

name: Distance Carbon Trekking Poles

description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Direttissima 55L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Direttissima 55L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Direttissima 55L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just got finished with a climbing trip in Nepal. Happy to say the pack held up excellently througout the entire trek with about 20 kilos, and it stripped down well for summit days. The numerous attachment options came in handy. I initially wasn't too sure about the attachment straps for the brain, but they turned out to be good for keeping my ropes out of the way. We ran into heavy rain, hail, snow, and a good amount of spindrift on the trip. I never used a pack cover. The main compartment stayed completely dry. The brain pockets seemed a bit less weather resistant, but nothing ever got too wet. Ice axe attchment worked well and the large gear loop was good for storing my axe when not using it. Over about 150 miles and 2 climbs I didn't have any thing on the pack break and I am not super careful with my gear.
review.name: Excellent pack for climbing / trekking

name: Direttissima 55L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I have been looking for an unstructured trucker hat for ao of time and this what exactly what I wanted.
review.name: Exactly what I wanted

review.reviewBody: Does what you'd expect.
review.name: A good hat

review.reviewBody: Old school "gimme hat". Very retro. Durable and I love the muted color. Reminds me of the hats they used to give you at the Farmer's COOP in the late 1970's when I was a young boy.
review.name: My favorite hat! Old School!!

review.reviewBody: Great color, great quality as always, love the low profile. Thanks, OR!
review.name: It's a hat

review.reviewBody: Cute but tough and love the style. Classic trucker hat!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Love these hats! They are comfy and tough, and come in many colours. I like the patch design as well. I bought some for me and one for my mom and I'm sure we'll be wearing them for years to come .
review.name: Classic!

review.reviewBody: I expected this to fit like other brand's trucker hats (eg TNF mudder), but it takes the low profile fit too extreme and rides halfway up my forehead. Not suitable for men with average head size or above.
review.name: Too low profile for most men

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Unstructured truckers are my favorite. This one seems to have gone through some extra design considerations. Strong materials and production are evident with inspection and use.
review.name: Trucker lux

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loved this hat and it fits great. I find most trucker hats are too big and this one was perfect!
review.name: Great fitting

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the hip yet classic look of this hat. I throw this on for hikes where I know I'm going to be exposed- recently wore this to summit Mount Adams! Gets the job done in terms of keeping the sun out of my eyes, and the mesh in the back keeps my head from overheating. Only deducted one star because it blew off my head once, but one notch tighter was too tight and hurt behind my ears a bit after an hour or so of wear
review.name: my go to hat!

name: Advocate Stripe Patch Cap

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for my husband and he loves them! He always had trouble with his feet sweating all day. He has no problems with these socks, in fact, he will only wear this sock now!! We have stocked up!!
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the second set of the merino hike+ light crew socks I have purchased, the last set lasted 5 years and were still going strong but I just wanted new socks. They are lightweight and dry quick.
review.name: Expensive but worth the price

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are my go to socks for hiking. No blisters and a smooth non-chafing fit
review.name: Smooth all day fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfortable with my Lowa's. Great for Alaska.
review.name: Love my socks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Still wearing them now. After a few days they have almost no smell from my usually sweaty feet. I bought 4 pairs and will buy more in the future.
review.name: Wearing them right now

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I prefer the early versions which are 100% merino. These are still comfortable and have a stretchiness to them. Have yet to use on the trail. Hope someday 100% merino will be back.
review.name: Initial thoughts

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the R/L specific design, gives my toes the room they've always dreamed of having!
review.name: Most comfortable socks!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Icebreaker makes some good stuff and these socks are no exception. Perfect fit and extremely comfortable!
review.name: Great socks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] 3 years ago, I went on a mission to find the perfect sock, purchasing many different brands and styles. over a full year of trial and error i found these the perfect Sock from icebreaker. So, I bought 10 pairs of the Hike+ Lightweight sock, 5 pairs of the Medium, and 5 pairs of the heavy weight sock. I ended up wearing the lightweight socks almost all year long, only switching to the thicker socks during the coldest part of the year. and with that the lightweight socks lasted about 2 years before developing holes at the big toe, but that may be due to an ill-fitting pair of boots. I can't say enough good things about these socks, they keep foot odder and blisters away after hiking all day. and keep my feet warm in the winter. the Fit is perfect and there are no seems or stitching that rub. Get yourself a pair and give them a try, you will not regret it.
review.name: I Found My Forever Sock

name: Hike+ Light Crew Sock

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this shoe for hiking after a great experience with xt6’s. The fit is perfect strong, durable and grippy sole but unfortunately the eyelets couldn’t handle the speed laces when I tighten them and broke on both shoes after only 5 days of hiking. All they need is a plastic bit inside the eyelet (just like the xt6’s) and they’d be perfect.
review.name: Great shoe but need reinforced eyelets

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got these as a result of claiming the warranty for a pair of shoes I had bought last year which broke dissapointingly easily and quickly but I am much happier with this pair. The warranty process was so quick and easy that it has restored my faith in salomon
review.name: Great looking and comfortable shoe

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are more comfortable than the x ultra 04 that I had before these. Toe box is slightly wider for better fit and comfort.
review.name: Better fit

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: bought these a couple weeks ago and they are the perfect blend for being able to use for just everyday general use for which having a comfortable and durable shoe was important but then also being able to use them on day hikes and still hold up asif they were a shoe built for hiking
review.name: epic sauce

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Took a good week of wear to break in. The uppers were stiff and creased very uncomfortably for a good while, and are still less comfortable than the X-Ultra 4s. But the tongue design is much better than that found on the X-Ultra, showing you to slip on the shoe very easily - just like the old design. A bigger range of colours would have been ideal.
review.name: Takes a while to break in

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Salomon shoes used to be amazing and I’ve had several pairs over the tears without any issues. These however are a huge step back. The pull on the laces broke almost immediately. Next to go was a lace eyelet within a week of use. Complete garbage.
review.name: Don’t waste your money

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I buy the Ulta's and the Xa Pro 3d for years. They are durable and stick on rocks.
review.name: Most durable shoes I got.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought for hike in Yosemite and death valley. They worked great!
review.name: Good hiking shoes!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wanted more than a trail runner but less than a boot. Great option.
review.name: Light and very stable.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 360 Edge GTX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I ended up returning these.

I was looking for a sturdy shoe, not boot, for hiking in New England.  These didn't seem all that sturdy compared to others, more like a stiffer trail running shoe.  Also, I've had Salomon XA Pro...whatever model shoes since 2004 and Salomon seems to be making things wider and wider, including the X Ultra here.  They fit well otherwise, but I had to sinch them up tight to fid width wise
review.name: Well for very light trail hiking

review.reviewBody: Great product with a lot to offer, specially the pockets.
review.name: Mountain stretch tight.

review.reviewBody: From a technical standpoint these tights are amazing. I've hiked in them multiple days in a row and they don't smell. They stay comfortable in a wide range of temps, even hiking uphill when I typically overheat like crazy, and they're warm even down in the 30s F just walking around town (haven't tried in colder temps yet). But the big problem with them is the fit - I have a shapely behind and these turn into saggy butt in the first 5 minutes of wearing them, and no matter how many times I pull them up it keeps happening. It's such a shame because they're extremely functional pants otherwise. For sizing reference: I'm 5'7" and 130 pounds and got a size small.
review.name: Fabric is amazing, fit not so much

review.reviewBody: 24 degrees and comfortable as a base layer. 35 degrees and comfortable on their own.
review.name: Comfortable on cold days

review.reviewBody: I purchased these based on the reviews and boy was everyone right! These are so comfortable, thin but warm. I own several Lulu and Athleta tights and these are by far my favorite of any tights I own.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: They fit great, but they're shorter than expected. I'm 5'10", 185 and large works.
review.name: If you're tall they'll be 7/8 but they are great!

review.reviewBody: Second pair of these. Stiffer more durable material than similar tights. Nice for running and hiking trails and general outdoor adventuring. They're not like suction to your legs tights. I like that.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: fits like a pyjama on my skin !!! really love these leggings fits like a glove, a bit loose - would not size down - fits perfect !!!
review.name: feels like wearing nothing !!!

review.reviewBody: I wore these in Canada last month in mid teens to low 20s.  No issues and was warm enough with these and insulated pants.  Others in our group had 3 layers and were still cold. Impressed enough I bought another pair when I got back.
review.name: Great for a base layer

review.reviewBody:
On fit, if you have a slender build, maybe size down.  As mentioned, I have M & S in different colors.  Fabric is opaque, but not heavy.  M fits me generously and comfortably. S is my correct size, no extra fabric.  I'm long-waisted and rise is pefect.
Length: All non-capri inseams are too long for me,  but these have less extra length than many - something to be aware of if you're tall / have long legs.
I'm 5ft zero, 140lbs, aging stocky athletic build with sprinter thighs, butt, calves, getting thick around the waist. Used to be a 4-6 at 120lbs, now a 6-8.
For comparison, other legwear I love right now: Patagonia Wind Shield pants size S, Rab Horizon tights size S.  These Mtn Hardwear tights are great as a base layer under both.
review.name: Love these -  addtl note on sizing

review.reviewBody:
Love these as a liner tight for winter.  Have 2 pair, M blue & S black.  No regrets.
Expecting I'll wear in spring/summer as single layer with hiking skirts.  Also see these as good for travel because of weight, comfort & drying time. 
The black at least could be worn without a skirt, if you do that sort of thing :)
Really like the fabric.  It is not spandex.  Does not seem to hold moisture, in a good way.
They are not pants - would not expose them to much abrasion.
Activity:  so far mostly running & walking in windy rain, snow & sleet as the liner layer under another more weather-facing tight like the Winter Journey etc
review.name: Love these

name: Mountain Stretch Tight - Women's

review.reviewBody: Crossbody bags lead to back pain for me, and I love carrying backpacks but sometimes they feel like too much. This little one is the perfect size for carrying my wallet, phone, ereader, and any little odds and ends I pick up along the way. It looks tiny but it fits a lot of stuff - without sacrificing style. My only complaint is that the material is pretty stiff, and the straps can be scratchy under my arms if I'm wearing a sleeveless top. However, definitely not a dealbreaker and I love being able to just toss in the necessities and go.
review.name: Perfect size to replace crossbody

review.reviewBody: I purchased 3 packs: Woodland Floral, Palm Grove & Night Tropical, these designs are one of a kind! The bag features 2 large pockets. The first pocket has convenient loops to attach keys or other extra items to the outside of the bag & when you open that pocket Dakine was thoughtful enough to keep you organized by providing: 2 open spaces for items, 3 pen slots with a mini mesh zip pocket to the right of those, & another mesh zip pocket on the flap side of the pocket. The main back pocket has enough space to keep bulkier items like phone, tablet, charger, bottle of water, perfume, etc along with a black zipper pocket inside to keep things tucked away safely. Nice, neat and versatile!
review.name: DO ALL DAKINES

review.reviewBody: I use this backpack as my everyday purse.  It's the perfect size.  It's comfortable and lightweight.  It stays on the shoulder when you just through over one arm.  It also can hold a lot if you need to pack more for a day away.  I wish there was a separate outside compartment for your phone, but it's not a dealbreaker.
review.name: Perfect Sized Daypack

name: Cosmo 6.5L Backpack - Women's

hasVariant.name: Metron 5D ACR 3K Integrated Handlebar
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vision Metron 5D ACR 3K Integrated Handlebar online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Shortly after completing the installation, the top layer of carbon fiber began to delaminate on the top cap. A small crack is also beginning to appear by the bolt hole. I use torque wrenches and everything was done to spec. 

The conundrum is: to send this back to CC involves new bar tape, a double brake bleed and re-wiring the replacement. In short, a huge hassle. Thus, I'd rather just get a new top cap, but they aren't available anywhere!  Given how expensive this bar is and how ubiquitous a traditional top caps are, FSA should have a ton of these on hand. I haven't reached out to FSA yet (have to wait until Monday) but if they don't have a satisfactory solution, I'll have to send the whole thing back. Again, given the cost of this item, I expected much better.
review.name: Carbon Fiber Delamination

name: Metron 5D ACR 3K Integrated Handlebar

review.reviewBody: I've used Grundéns foul weather gear for years and never had a problem with them, so I was confident their waders would be as reliable. So far I have not been disappointed. I used Simms waders for years, but they have steadily declined--especially since Simms new managment took over.  The deal breaker was a two-year old pair of G4z's that lasted two years before they started leaking at the seams. I sent them in for repair and Simms sent them back, claiming they had "outlived their usefulness." I don't get to fish that often, and take good care of my equipment. Given their quality and workmanship I know my Grundéns Boundary zip waders will last.
review.name: No More G4s!

review.reviewBody: I am a guide on the Delaware River and have worn these waders for over 100 days.  I have also owned Simms, Reddington and Patagonia.  Simms are very good waders;l however, they are not as good as Grundens.  The claims are  real - the Grundens are most comfortable and ergonomic.  They are also just as durable as 100 days on the water have shown (I waited to write a review until I had a chance to fish them hard.)  Grundens are significantly better than any other wader on the market.
review.name: Best I Have Found

review.reviewBody: I have always bought the best waders I could find and have certainly used some great product over the years.  The first time I fished in these I was utterly amazed at how comfortable they are, it was almost like I didn't have waders on at all!  Very comfortable!
review.name: Best Waders Ever!!!

review.reviewBody: Best pair of waders I have owned. As a fly fishing guide at an Alaskan float plane lodge you need gear that will not let you down. After wearing these waders every day for 4 months straight I am Amazed at how well they held up. Little to no wear on the neoprene booties and not a single leaky seam the entire season. As all my other coworkers simms and Patagonia waders started to fall apart my Grundens stayed solid. They also fit better than most other waders than I have tried. One thing that would be very nice is removable knee pads for inside the wader.
review.name: Bombproof Waders

review.reviewBody:
Fit is very close to perfect (size small-short).  Fitting my short stubby frame is near impossible with my previous waders, these are a dream come true.

The stocking foot slips into my boots without any wrinkles.

I have been fishing daily in these.
review.name: Boundary Gore-Tex Zip Stocking Foot Wader

review.reviewBody: The waders are very comfortable. The shoulder straps are awesome. You do not feel any weight on your shoulders. The wading belt is the best I’ve ever worn. I’ve worn my waders almost everyday for the last 3 months and am very happy with the fit and how comfortable they are. Well done!!
review.name: The best waders on the market

review.reviewBody: The zipper is fantastic! Easy on and off, and other reasons, IYKYK. The shoulder straps are the best I have worn. Gore Tex material is awesome and durable.
review.name: Boundary Waders

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable and tough waders.  I've  had several steelhead trips here in Oregon with them.  Great in the drift boat, great wading and great brush busting!
review.name: Comfortable and tough

review.reviewBody: Great wader that keeps you dry and doesn't restrict your movements.
review.name: Great Waders

review.reviewBody: Been through many pairs of waders over the years. Lots of competition benefits the consumer and Grundens waders and gortex jacket have proven to be my go-to for everything - Patagonia, local rafting rivers, wading… they are light, easy to pack, super durable and adjust very nicely to accommodate different shapes and sizes. Don’t hesitate. There are many reasons why these should be at the top of your list.
review.name: Absolutely the best waders on the market!

review.reviewBody: Love the 2-wheel kit. It makes the Burley a great stroller. My only wish is that when purchasing I could opt out of the wheel kit that comes on the arm that attaches to your bike. It makes no sense to me to have to pay for both. When choosing the 2-wheel kit it should give you a credit for the one wheel kit.
review.name: Love the 2-wheel kit. It

review.reviewBody:
I use my cart for biking, running and walking around town. 

It is easy to transition from on to the other. 

For biking, my issue is the safety strap that you are to rap around the bike frame. Two of my bike have disk brakes. I take care to insure the safety strap cannot get caught in the brake, but feel it is only a matter of time.

For running and walking my comments are the same. I struggle rolling the front mesh up for a better view and my air for my son. I also wish there was a half open option. I wish there was a way to open the plastic in the back for air flow and conversation. 

My last thing I noticed was there was no way to hold the cart closed after folding it up, (I guess unless you get the bags).
review.name: Great Cart just minor things

review.reviewBody: Epic comfy rides. The suspension in burley is so good. It makes it for the best ride for my 1-year-old. Plenty of room for snacks and storage
review.name: Epic comfy rides. The suspension

review.reviewBody: We love to ride to the beach towing our kiddo in the Cub x to the weekly farmers market. Once we get there, we lock up the bikes, add these puppies on and push him around in stroller mode. Much nicer than the normal bar that sticks out quite a bit. Turns on a dime and very smooth. Highly recommend!
review.name: Great addition to our Cub X!

review.reviewBody: Well built, stable and lightweight. But with confidence
review.name: Well built, stable and lightweight.

review.reviewBody: My little one loves it.
review.name: Everything we wanted

review.reviewBody: We love our Burley. With the 2-wheel kit, it's so easy to stroll around, even in the city! The big wheels make it much easier to push that regular double stroller. The wind shield makes a nice "bubble" to keep the kids warm in the winter. Also, it's the same width as a rolling chair so it fits through most doors and if it doesn't, you can advocate for more accessibility in a store. Our first Burley was stollen last winter and we bought a second one because we just love the model so much.
review.name: We love our Burley. With

review.reviewBody: We added the two wheel kit for the trailer for our elderly dog when he tires. We used to use the single wheel that was attached to the bike but it extended out pretty far and we had to be really careful not to trip people in crowded areas. The two wheel kit did the trick.
review.name: Compact and works well

review.reviewBody: We have two miniature schnauzers and bought the bark ranger and the additional stroller kit. The dogs LOVE their trailer. It is super easy to convert between the bike attachment and the stroller wheels and gives them a safe space to be when we’re out for dinner or anywhere more crowded. Would highly recommend!
review.name: Love Love Love

review.reviewBody: Bought this to go with my 2018 encore. Had high hopes but the wheels are SUPER noisy. I think it’s the little suspension springs they have installed but they rattle a tonne. I’m not sure I’m going to be able to use them much because the noise drives me crazy. Really disappointed because otherwise I think I’d use these stroller wheels a lot with the trailer.
review.name: Eh. They’re ok. Noisy

description: Buy the Selle SMP Bar Tape Grip Gel online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Bar Tape Grip Gel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Selle SMP Bar Tape Grip Gel online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Ok, so I went back into my order history to figure out exactly when I bought this...Nov 2020.  It was on major discount so like another reviewer I decided to give the expensive bar tape a shot.  I installed it myself and it went on very easily and had no issues.  It never ripped, but I was careful putting it on.  It has great padding and the grip is superb.  My hands sweat a lot in the Texas heat and these things keep their grip even with soaking wet hands/gloves.  It is now Jan 2023, and the same pair is still on my bike after nearly 10k miles.  They are definitely showing wear, but the padding is still second to none and the grip is still there.  I don't anticipate changing them out any time soon.  Just wanted to come back and throw in a review since most items are not reviewed after the first few months.  I love them and would purchase them again in a heartbeat!
review.name: Very happy with purchase

review.reviewBody: I've used Fizik for years but for $19, decided to try the Selle tape.  It wrapped just fine and feels great to ride on.  I've ridden over 3K miles on the tape and will order another couple rolls for my next 3K miles.
review.name: Works for me

review.reviewBody: Ripped right at the shifter/ brake lever junction while wrapping the bars of my Merlin Empire. Well, it would have looked nice. But, it was just 20 bucks so I just told the mechanic to chuck it and use Black Shimano Pro tape.
review.name: Beautiful, but ripped

review.reviewBody: The bar tape ripped as I was applying it, and I wasn't even stretching it that much. Feels very plastic, too.
review.name: Garbage

review.reviewBody: Firstly, the tape is rolled in a tight wad and stored in the packaging. The back of the tape has mild adhesive on it, and upon rolling out the wad of tape; some of the adhesive pulled part of the front of the tape from its base layer and pretty much ripped the tape from the get-go. This tape is not durable or rip proof compared to other's that I have used. Firstly, it is not  well made due to the the fact that the front of the tape pretty much delaminated while being unrolled. Secondly, the tape did indeed rip upon applying mild pressure (which is required to wrap your bars).  I would totally return or exchange this tape if I could; however, seeing as how it ripped right out of package, I don't think that is possible. Selle, please stick to saddles. Do not recommend this bar tape.
review.name: Quality is not on par

review.reviewBody: I saw it marked way down and snagged the black tape thinking let's see what $50 bartape is like. It's awesome. It has been a great experience from the packaging to the road. I was happy to see they leave the annoying paper strip on the adhesive out. Those things are the worst. It has a relatively thick and smushy feel and it has the best stretchiness I've ever encountered when wrapping. Other brands are thick and plush, but have a separate surface that can wrinkle and eventually peel like a lizard's skin. This stuff is one ultra-fine substance all the way through. It's rubbery but not too tacky. I might prefer a touch more grip but it's fine. I'm impressed.
review.name: Great Tape

name: Bar Tape Grip Gel

review.reviewBody: After trying 6 wetsuits of varying styles and sizes, this was the winner by far!  It is super cute and sexy.  I am 5’4”, 120 lbs (clothes size 4-6) and the size 6 was perfect.  Originally ordered an 8 as the other wet suits I tried were really small, but exchanged it for the 6.  Have to comment, some of the zipper lengths on other wet suits (brand starting with R) were super short, and made it impossible to pull the waist of the suit up over my hips!  This wetsuit zipper opens up to just below the waist so it was easy to pull up.  I’m a Live-Aboard sailor and plan on using this all winter in the Bahamas, can’t wait to go snorkeling with it.  Highly recommend this suit!
review.name: Super Cute, Fits Well

review.reviewBody: I have worn this Castelli jersey a number of times and it really performs in the hot humid weather of south Florida.   The material is light and breathes well to keep me comfortable.
review.name: Cool for hot

review.reviewBody:
I'm 5'7'', 125 lbs. My measurements are 32-26.5-37. Based off the recommendation to size up, I did just that and ordered a medium. The quality of the jersey seems fine but the overall fit is just wrong. I have broad shoulders and lean muscular arms. The jersey was tight for both - like form-fitting to the max. However when it came to the torso, it was baggy.

Now I do not enjoy paying return shipping, but I know I won't wear this. Sending it back
review.name: Odd fit - returned

review.reviewBody: This jersey is excellent for warm weather with more ventilation than most jerseys including the front. It is typical Castelli some slim fitting. I am 5'4", 125 lbs athletic figure, ordered a M and it fits skin tight. The styling is Castelli so it is nice with attention to detail. You need to wear a bra, base layer or bibs with mesh on the front because the front material is fully ventilated - see thru. I bought the light blue/aqua.
review.name: Excellent jersey for warm weather

review.reviewBody:
This jersey is marketed towards climbers. If you’re a climber, you’re probably also a “descender.” The problem is that the front body of this jersey is so loose that it flaps in the wind on descents. It doesn’t help that they used a bulkier zipper, which tends to bunch up more than the thinner zippers when used with such thin fabric. There’s also a bit of fabric on the shoulders that flaps, even after adjusting the sleeves.

I wish Castelli would make this more of a race cut because I otherwise like the top. The fabric is very comfortable and keeps cool on hot rides. The seamless sleeves are comfortable. The neckline sits comfortably without poking my neck.

This could be a great top if you have trouble with jerseys being too tight in the abdomen.
review.name: May be for climbers, not descenders

name: Climber's 2.0 Jersey - Women's

review.reviewBody: I wear these boots with jeans, shorts, skorts and whatever! They go with everything.... Except my bunions.
review.name: Super cute, but tuff on the bunions

review.reviewBody: These boots have fared well for various types of rocky, and even some steep trails. They are so multipurpose, fit so well, and I have gotten so many compliments on how cute they are. I would definitely recommend as an all-around boot.
review.name: Great, all-around boot!

review.reviewBody: I loooove these boots - they have a sort of deep purple hue mixed with brown that makes them so perfect for fall. I definitely recommend wearing thicker socks to start but that's like any new boot - love the look and they feel awesome!
review.name: So stylish!

review.reviewBody: I got these boots in a small town shoe store and immediately fell in love. after the first day of wearing them for 4 hours i had raw blisters on both feet at the inside of my ankle, just above my heel. the back arch piece behind the achilles heel has threading on the inside so the rubbing is INSANE. i've had them for 2 weeks now and still have to bandage my ankles with extra cushion wrap. once they're wrapped the shoes are amazing and comfy but without the wrap they absolutely tear my feet up. i'm normally shoe size 7 but bought a 7.5 to avoid this issue.. hoping it'll go away when they're finally broken in.
review.name: Amazing boot, slightly awkward fit

review.reviewBody: these are my favorite boots. I go through boots very fast and usually they become uncomfortable within a year so the 1.5 years these lasted me is a record. that being said I don't think I would buy them again because they squeeze my toes together and create tiny calluses on my toes. the one star deducted is for this reason. if they made this exact boot with a wider toe box I would buy them in every color. My heels tend to get very tender after long days on concrete but the platform cushions my heel perfectly. Teva please make these with a wider toe box!
review.name: I wore them in construction for almost two years

review.reviewBody: I am in love with this boot, it fits perfect, is so comfortable, and do so well in rain. I would not recommend this boot for hiking as the sole is kind of awkward and mine wore down in less than a year, I slipped off my porch in these one day because the sole is worn down so much. I'd definitely buy these again if they went on sale or made better, lasting tread
review.name: Favorite boot ever but sole wears out fast

review.reviewBody: I bought these last fall to wear for work. I work the grocery delivery apps full time. I need shoes that I can walk and carry in all day but are still cute. Also they needed to be good for winter. These have done a great job. Aside from being a little dirty they show almost no wear yet. I like that they are holding up. They even look cute with dresses. They are much like a traditional hiking boot in that they have to be laced tightly to provide a good fit. I don't like them loose because then my heel just slides all around causing pain. There is no side zipper so that means taking them on and off is more difficult. That's a drawback of wearing them day to day. The only other drawback is that they are only water resistant. It's been a rainy winter here. They do pretty well but I have felt the damp at least once. I do recommend them.
review.name: These are my work boots.

review.reviewBody: These are super waterproof, I live in Wisconsin and they have been great with both snow and rain! They also have a great cushiony feel. They're not completely immune to slipping on ice but I can't really expect that from any boot. I am normally a 10.5, I got the 11 and they fit great!
review.name: great stuff

review.reviewBody: I have the black and now have purchased the white.
review.name: Midform Boot

review.reviewBody: Have been wearing Teva for years. This is one of the best casual boots I own(and I have every color). True to size. I can wear all day at work and they did not need a "break in" period. Highly recommend!
review.name: Comfortable and stylish

name: Midform Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
This is a wonderful coat. Unlike a lot of Canada Goose?s parkas, this one is filled with more technical features like the other Hybridge line. For instance, the pockets are two sided with fleece lined pockets for your hands but with deeper pockets that also work as side vents. There are uninsulated strips under the arms that help make the jacket less constricting and improve movement. The suspenders inside the jacket made me laugh at first because they seem silly, but they actually came very handy when we were indoors in a warm hotel or museum and there was no coat check. The hood isn?t as big as the hoods on their parkas, but it?s still got plenty of insulation.
This jacket is great for the city and looks very stylish too, but it?s also been great when we go to the mountains or when it?s frigid on my commute to work.
It?s a mid-weight coat, and is definitely a slim fit, but still room for a heavy sweater underneath. You really could just wear a t-shirt underneath.
Overall, a great coat that isn?t as heavy as a parka but still packed with warm down and isn?t constricting.
review.name: Excellent Technical Coat

review.reviewBody:
Absolutely terrific! Had a chance to try on a friends. Perfect fit, comfortable and well made. All I could ever want in a jacket. 
Love the light green. Hope you get more. A nice BIG sale would make me smile. Have a nice weekend.
review.name: Backwoods

name: Hybridge Coat - Men's

description: Buy the Abbey Bike Tools L. L. Chain Wear Tool online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: L. L. Chain Wear Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Abbey Bike Tools L. L. Chain Wear Tool online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Hands down my new favorite bike-specific tool.  Who doesn't love Abbey Tools?  They re-think tools and make them beefier, better, and well.. green.  Speaking of green - bike components are expensive! They suck to have to replace, especially if it's due to user error.. like riding a worn chain on a a top-tier drivetrain (yeah SRAM flattop chains, I'm talking to you).

This tool is CNC'd from solid billet, and has 2 variations of measurement (lateral & roller wear).  Given that 1x drivetrains are increasing the frequency of cross-chaining, this lateral measurement is much appreciated.  

Did I mention it's green?
review.name: Precision Tools Made Precisely

name: L. L. Chain Wear Tool

review.reviewBody: I wanted to find a small hydration backpack to use while mountain biking, this one is perfect. It's large enough to hold daily riding essentials but not as big or bulky as the larger backpacks.
review.name: Great for mountain biking

review.reviewBody: I got this pack for my trip to Chamonix where numerous day hikes took place. The pack held plenty of water and fit my rain jacket, which definitely came in handy. The small zipper pocket perfectly held my lift card, which I definitely could not lose.
review.name: Great for summer hikes

review.reviewBody:
For cycling, this pack is everything I was looking for and more! I was hesitant, reading the reviews of this and other Osprey hydration packs, but with a little Google help and some attention to detail I can counter many of the negative comments I've seen. 

Here's the basic pluses though:
I wanted something that not only held H2O for MTB trails, but could also work for layers and lunch on longer days and rail-trail rides. I liked that this held a full 2L bladder and also had that extra external zip pack pocket. 
When I first took this out of the package and put it on, I thought it was too narrow and nearly returned it. Instead I tested it out by adding a tablet and stuffing a shirt in. The weight put the pack in place and it's perfect!
Some reviewers complained about the difficulty with the magnet on the end of the mouthpiece. I believe those folks may not have realized a - that you can cut the hose so that it is the right length for you personally, b - that the hose may come on the wrong side (Mine came attached to the left shoulder strap, which for me being right-handed needed to be on the right shoulder) and c - that the little magnetized clip comes loose. Once you move it so that it slides freely - I had no issues getting it clipped on the first try - easy easy - on a 3-hour trail ride recently. And after cutting the hose a couple of inches, it's even easier, though honestly it was also fine before.

Here's what really caused me to love this though: the size!! Holy cow this little pack holds a lot!! 
I did a 3-hour/30-mile rail trail ride recently in SW Virginia. It was a cool day, low 60's and cloudy, so I knew I'd likely be on/off/on/off with my light wind jacket. I also thought if the sun came out I'd probably get hot enough to want short sleeves. 

So on my inaugural test ride with the new pack - it held the following:

2 full liters of water (plus an extra bottle clipped in my cage on the bike, just in case) 
lunch plus snacks (sandwich, apple, to-go cup of peanut butter and multiple bars/packs of nuts/etc)
phone
keys
wallet with ID/insurance cards/etc
a drywick t-shirt
my light wind jacket (which I indeed took on and off throughout the day!)
Earbuds in charging case
Small travel/emergency bike pump 
pack of tissues
ziplock bag of sanitizer wipes for restrooms along the way (glad I had those!)
various other items - chapstick, small container of advil, band-aids, etc....

ALL of that was inside the zippered pouch of the pack and it was surprisingly not full, even so. Seriously - this little pack holds a TON of stuff!! 
The two outside pockets I didn't even use on this trip - but was thrilled to know I had that space for future, especially with the seasons changing and the need for heavier clothes comes into play. I can't wait. |

*side note to add that it is also super lightweight and not hot. I was surprised to find that to be the case, as I tend to heat up easily, but no extra back sweat, no discomfort at all. Even fully loaded at the start, full water bladder, the pack was completely unnoticeable.

Truly, this little thing would be my go-to pack of choice for planes, volcano hikes, and any other outing and adventure.

Now if we could just get rid of this little virus so I can travel again... 

'Til then, it'll be 2 wheels and 2 feet! Off we go!
review.name: I wish I'd gotten this months ago!

review.reviewBody: Love this pack! It fits everything you would need for a day long hike.
review.name: Tiny but mighty

name: Kitsuma 7L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd pair of Ramblers. I started with 40mm, liked them, 45mm was better on pavement and much better off road, and 50mm is best of all. These tires breathed new life into my old xc hardtail, which became a flat bar gravel bike. They also work great on the pump track.
review.name: Excellent from pavement to singletrack

review.reviewBody:
I bought this tire to try just a month ago. I did a gravel ride in Lyons, Co. and the conditions were really sloppy as it had snowed the night before and was about 36 degrees at riding time. I had 43's on the bike and I went to 40's based on tips and feedback.  I am 220 lbs and rode at 32 psi. They were fantastic in the 20 miles of mud and snow. There were over 1000 riders churning up the roads and I felt pretty confident considering this was my first 
gravel event.
review.name: Sloppy Colorado

review.reviewBody: Came with my bike, lasted a while, but flats nearly every other run. Run smooth, good handling in corners, but I'm tired of patching and replacing tires. So thin, tiny little goat heads are getting through nearly every ride.
review.name: Decent

review.reviewBody: This tire was just imperfect out of the box. Ordered a pair and the wobble in the tire was so bad even perfectly seated. Built tough but also built with too many defects. Would recommend another time that rides softer and is made to a higher standard.
review.name: Durable BUT Poor Quality

review.reviewBody: These were super easy to install and get tubeless. I dig the tread pattern. They seem great. Eager to get some good miles on them.
review.name: Love the tread pattern & Maxxis quality

review.reviewBody: I think I found the perfect tire for my Nukeproof gravel bike, I got the 45mm model and at  40 psi they are exactly 45 mm wide, they roll well on tarmac and have nice grip on the loose dirt, they were the easiest tire to set up tubeless I have ever owned, set the bead on my DT Swiss rims with no problem.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: I decided to use these on a recent gravel race in DuPont State Forest and could not have been happier.  Held up well and allowed me to corner fast.
review.name: Great in smooth and rough

review.reviewBody:
I ride a combo of paved, gravel, and singletrack (some rough) and these tires fit the bill. I ride aggressively and the harder I push these tires the better they perform. They track well and you can rail around a corner or tail whip around depending on your weight point. These tires will reward a rider who gives direct inputs to their bike and has strong riding skills. They aren't a fire and forget tire, you can't just expect them to hold in all conditions but if you ride properly in any given condition you'll be rewarded.

They roll fast, grip and track well. 

I run 40's on a 25mm inner width rim. They measure out to a little over 42mm.
review.name: Great Tire for Me

review.reviewBody: I set these up before Belgian Waffle Ride Cedar City and couldn't have been happier!  Sealed up great, without any issue and they roll really fast!
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody:
The tire was pretty easy to seat on the bead but and everything sealed up nicely.  After my first 40 mile ride I lost about 10psi.  Took it to the LBS for a fresh rim retape.  No dice.  Further investigation with soapy bubbles revealed two spots on the tread that are pissing air more than Stan's can seal.  Not what I would expect from "Tubeless Ready".

Edit: To be clear - the bead sealed fine.  The leak is coming from the tread, right at one of the knobs. Trying to change to picture to help show this (I couldn't get the close up to focus properly.).
review.name: Doesn't seal
comment: Use Orange Seal instead of Stans! This is not an issue with the tires. I throw my gravel bike down singletrack in the rocky northeast without any issue. These tires roll fast on the road and gravel. My tires seated with no issues with a floor pump on Santa Cruz Reserve 650b rims.
A tire failing to seal after a puncture isn't a problem with the tire. Either the puncture is too big for sealant to plug or you need to use a better sealant than Stans.
I don't have issues sealing and I'm somewhat careless to others when it comes to avoiding crap trails/roads and obstacles. No issues with sealing or anything else really.
I have the same issue... loses pressure, overnight totally drains...shit tire..
So do mine. I've had more than 5 of these tires and they all seem to go on pretty easily.
Could it be your rim? Mine seal fine.

name: Rambler Tubeless Tire
Rambler Tubeless Tire

description: Buy the Industry Nine Hydra Trail S 29in Boost Wheelset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hydra Trail S 29in Boost Wheelset
hasVariant.description: Buy the Industry Nine Hydra Trail S 29in Boost Wheelset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Didn?t realize Industry Nine was a top tier wheelset brand, in particular the Hydra hubs, until I read articles, watched YouTube reviews, and received compliments from others. I was a bit concerned about rolling resistance of the freehub body, but that was an issue with the previous model, the Torch. There seemed to be some rolling resistance when spinning the wheel on my bike stand, but hard to tell on the trail. By the 3rd ride of about 10 miles each, I noticed a difference in freehub resistance.  It definitely seemed to coast much longer on the bike stand, but I could notice the difference on the trail. They just seemed to roll real nice compared to the stock DT Swiss XM 1900 wheels I had previously. 

I noticed right away the handling. My previous wheelset had a 30mm internal rim width, which is great if you?re pointing the wheel south to do some gnarly terrain with big drops, but for XC and trail terrain, the 27mm inner rim width of the I9, is more responsive and easier to control through technical terrain and switch backs. 

Setting up the wheelset to tubeless was the easiest setup I?ve ever done. It was so easy that I didn?t have to use soapy water or remove the valve core to blast it with air from my compressor. I mounted the tires and used my floor pump, that was it. After four rides the tire pressure held with no leaks without using sealant. 

Ah the engagement....didn?t know this was a hot topic with aftermarket wheels until I read the reviews and found the I9 Hydra is the gold standard when it comes to the most efficient engagement.  I didn?t realize how bad my DT Swiss stock wheels were until I mounted these I9?s on my bike and actually went on the trail.  It?s like comparing a 720 to 4K TV high definition. The 720 is ok because you don?t know any better, but once you get that 4K, nothing else compares. The Hydra?s engagement is instantaneous, I mean there is no noticeable play in the engagement from the moment you mash down on the pedals to when the rear wheel puts power to the ground. 

The I9 Hydra?s buzzing is adjustable by either applying a specific brand of thicker grease to the pawls to make them more quiet, or oil to make them more audible. I prefer the stock grease with a subtle buzzing that is very distinctive. If you?re like me and think the sound will annoy you, it doesn?t at all and it sounds quite cool and unique.  

Looks, they are absolutely cool looking wheels and the rims are equally impressive. The rims have a pattern what appears to be lasered on the surface that is unique to I9, and the laser etching on the hubs surface is precise and pops with the black anodized finish of the hub shells. So far I have been impressed with these wheels after only four rides and hope they continue to impress as I rack on more miles 

Cheers!
review.name: Top Tier Wheelset

review.reviewBody: Best bang for the buck.  I can buy 2 1/2 of these wheelers for the price of carbon, and they are sooooo nice.  Replaced some worn out high $$$ carbon hoops with these and the bike feels brand new.  They are so snappy and responsive, and I don't have to worry so much about abusing them because I can afford to replace them.  You won't be disappointed.
review.name: Wow!

name: Hydra Trail S 29in Boost Wheelset

hasVariant.name: Discover Seatpost
hasVariant.description: Buy the PRO Discover Seatpost online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is a high quality seatpost.  First of all, it is round.  I had a lot of problem lately with other seatpost that are off.   The Pro discovery seatpost was made perfectly.

It is easy to adjust.  It comes with inserts for round and also 7x9 rails.   The 7x9 fit prologo carbon rail.    You will need a torque wrench and 5mm socket to torque it to about 13nm.  So far I have used 11nm and it is holding up.

I feel the dyneema does dampen the vibration a bit and that's my opinion.
It has a smooth ride quality to it, not a magic amount of difference of course.    It's not like a having a suspension.
I am using this post on the road and it is easy to tell over chipseals.
review.name: quality

review.reviewBody: I replaced an aluminum Easton seatpost on my Cervelo Aspero with the Pro Discover Carbon Seatpost and cannot believe how much it has improved the ride.  I just don't think about any of the jarring and bumps coming through the seat anymore, which is the best compliment you can pay your equipment when you're looking for improvements to your ride in search of additional comfort.
review.name: Added Compliance To The Seat Area

name: Discover Seatpost

review.itemreviewed: Midweight Stretch Long-Sleeve Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this for a winter camping trip.  The temperatures dropped down to the low forties at night and I never felt cold.  I love it and would buy it again.  I normally wear a size Medium but decided to get a Large, based on other reviews.  It's a little loose, but it's nice if you want to be able to wear it like a shirt and not be too fitted.
review.name: Comfortable and warm!

review.itemreviewed: Midweight Stretch Long-Sleeve Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I tend to be on the cold side so this top is great for indoors or outdoors!
review.name: Perfect addition to my outdoor clothing!

review.itemreviewed: Midweight Stretch Long-Sleeve Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Is there a limit to how many we can buy? This shirt is amazing! The yoga pants for the chichi’s. An incredible base layer, but good enough to wear around a la carte when it is over 45°.
review.name: We will be buying more of these

review.itemreviewed: Midweight Stretch Long-Sleeve Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I find as I get older that I feel more colder as the fall/winter season approaches.  This is the first Omni-Heat™ Midweight Baselayer Crew I've ordered to try.  I ordered a 2nd one but it hasn't come yet.    The shirt fits fine and seems to keep my shoulders warmer.

review.itemreviewed: Midweight Stretch Long-Sleeve Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable for under my snow gear. Warm enough to wear alone on warm ski days

review.itemreviewed: Midweight Stretch Long-Sleeve Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Soft, well made...quality fabric and oh so comfortable. It fits well and snug under my clothing. The omni heat touches the skin but feels like soft clothing. It keeps me warm and toasty under light fabric which shocked me. The color is beautiful also.
review.name: Quality Fabric and Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Midweight Stretch Long-Sleeve Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this. It keeps me warm when just walking around outside and when doing activities
review.name: Love it!

review.itemreviewed: Midweight Stretch Long-Sleeve Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very warm and comfortable. It’s a little tight so you may want to size up.
review.name: Very Warm

review.itemreviewed: Midweight Stretch Long-Sleeve Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: Awesome, very comfy and warm o just loved it, I’m gonna get another one

review.itemreviewed: Midweight Stretch Long-Sleeve Baselayer Top - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fits fine otherwise, but the way the shape of the fabric is cut around the sleeves creates an over abundance of fabric in the armpits, and with the crinkly interior texture, it is not comfortable. It's a shame, since I liked another Columbia's base layer, in a medium. I usually wear a M. I'm a 38C and was wearing an athletic bra that flattens my chest.

name: Midweight Stretch Long-Sleeve Baselayer Top - Women's

review.reviewBody: Phenomenal shorts! Very comfy, very light and adjustable waistband is great too. Zip pocket and side pockets are amazing
review.name: The perfect running shorts!

review.reviewBody: Love these shorts. The 5" inch is great, they are tight enough to my legs and hug my waist well so that they don't moving during any movements. I use them for running, weightlifting, and playing volleyball. The pockets are quite small, my phone sticks halfway out when I have it in there. It's enough to hold it while walking but would fall out while running. Ultimately, these are great workout shorts that are now my go-to shorts.
review.name: Great workout shorts

review.reviewBody:
No zip phone pocket on thigh as shown in photos. Zip pocket on rear waistband does not fit any standard phone in 2024.  
A great fitting short lacking basic functionality for modern runners. Disappointed and returned.

Generally a solid pair of shorts, but I felt that the pockets bounced too much when loaded with enough gels for a marathon. For shorts with this many pockets I had hoped they would be a little better at carrying the load nicely.
review.name: Good but bouncy when fully loaded.

review.reviewBody: Fantastic shorts - been looking for some shorts that were as good as my old Better Than Naked. Finally found them! I'm a Sherpa convert
review.name: I'm a convert

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased the Sherpa 5 shorts and have mixed feelings. On the positive side, they're well-constructed with high-quality materials. The zippered pocket is a standout feature - it's generously sized and perfect for securely carrying essentials during a run.
However, I've encountered an issue during use: the shorts tend to ride up along the inner thighs while running. This can be uncomfortable and requires frequent adjustment, which interrupts the flow of my workout.

While the overall quality is there, this fit issue makes it difficult for me to fully recommend these shorts for running activities. They might work better for other types of exercise where this wouldn't be as much of an issue.
review.name: Good construction, but some fit issues

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable shorts that hold some of the necessary items as you set out on a run or hike. Very happy with the product and will purchase more.
review.name: Comfortable shorts

review.reviewBody:
Great shorts and very conformable.
Light weight and really don't notice them. Breif liner stays in place well. Waist band is soft and stretchy with plenty of storage. Also very breathable.
I went for size small whereas normally I get medium in other brands and they fit fine but are slightly more streamlined. If you want a more relaxed fit I'd stick with your normal side in other brand running shorts.
review.name: Great running shorts!

review.reviewBody: Great fit in waist that keeps phone tight against lower back when running.  Lots of pockets for gels on long runs. My reason for 4/5 stars is that the liner has a somewhat thonglike fit that doesn't fully give me a wedgie but is kind of close- I've never had this problem from a Brooks pair of shorts before, or any other brand for that matter.
review.name: Great short, great storage

review.reviewBody: Good pair of running shorts. Wore on a 10 mile run. They were comfortable. But I felt the shorts on the inside of my legs riding up often and I would have to readjust. Not a big deal and it could totally be my gait causing this. Liner is secure and kept everything in place.
review.name: Good but not my favorite

name: Sherpa 5in Short - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Togir 3 Slide Harness online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this harness for my move to France. Some of the best climbing gyms in the world are in Paris where I was based. I used it 50+ times over the past year that I lived in Paris. For this harness I would say it’s a great price point, I felt safe using it, didn’t have issues with it rubbing against my skin when I wore shorts, loved the look to it, easy to break in, and got many compliments on it. Used it for top rope throughout Europe. Would highly recommend getting this to anyone looking for a good climbing harness and would get this as a gift for my friends any day.
review.name: My favorite in door climbing harness

review.reviewBody: 6'2" 150lbs I got the Small. Fits great. I like how they did firm gear loops in front and soft ones in the back. Reasonably comfy harness to climb, belay or rappel in.
review.name: Togir 2.0

review.reviewBody:
I have the Togir 1.0. I love it. Slim and has great gear loops. Padded but not bulky. Stylish but not flashy (Olive Green).
Got the Togir 2.0 to give it a shot/have an extra harness for the boulder bros.
Overall, I like the harness. It’s super comfy and has softer padding than the 1.0. Stays pretty true to form with the original.
However, my complaints are with the gear loops.
First, I with they weren’t orange. Cosmetic I know, but it isn’t my vibe. Second, the rear gear loops being soft is a little bit of a bummer after becoming accustomed to the hard, “self feeding” loops on the 1.0.
I would recommend this for someone in the market for a sport harness. If you have a Togir 1.0 that still serves you well, maybe hold off.
review.name: Super comfy!

review.reviewBody: Easy to adjust and wear, comfortable too. Use this several times a week for indoor climbing and also outdoors. Has held up nicely so far.
review.name: Great harness for indoor and outdoor climbing

review.reviewBody: Good all around harness, but def ran small. The fit chart was not on point.
review.name: Decent Harness, but Runs SMALL

review.reviewBody: Pleasant place to sit while belaying, comfy while climbing, but one of the gear loops is starting to wear quite hard despite not using this harness as much as others. only having the two full size gear loops is fine for sport but I can see it being frustrating if you plan to do anything more than single pitches or trad.
review.name: Comfy, works well in 99% of applications

review.reviewBody: This harness gives me the comfort of taking big whips and light on my hips. Used the Ophir Slide 3 for years and just found a new upgrade. The hard draw loops are way nice for single pitch sport outdoors as I don't have to worry about my draws flying all over the place. The rigid plastic keeps them close to my body allowing for faster clipping even though I'm not that fast. Well good and love Mammut
review.name: Super light sleek harness

review.reviewBody: I needed a new trad climbing and route development harness, so I went with this because it looked comfortable, has a fifth smaller rear reinforced haul loop, and looked like it had plenty of space on the gear loops.  I don't know if I got a defective one, but the two back gear loops are quite shallow, and it's hard to clip gear to it on the go by feel or while hanging on a rope since the loops are so shallow/small.  They are barely usable, but not what I would have hoped for based on the picture which makes the loops look like they hang way down and look large.  Also, they seem durable enough, but every harness I've had before this one had thicker gear loops.  The rear gear loops on this harness are quite thin comparatively.  Other than that, it is fairly comfortable, and I like the lower hard point plastic protector piece.  It makes the belay loop run very smoothly in the lower hard point, and I could see the hard points lasting a long time.  The belay loop seems burly and has the indicator when it's worn out, so both of those are good things.  In addition, the front gear loops have a small thin section that is not reinforced with plastic that is already fraying after one use outside (see picture)!
review.name: Back gear loops are shallow and much smaller than advertised

review.reviewBody:
I have been using this harness heavily for a couple weeks now, and with the exception of a couple slight drawbacks I am pretty pleased with it! 

Definitely an alpine harness, but I initially bought it to replace my current gym harness which is very light and fast, but not quite comfortable or stout enough to hang around in for extended periods of time checking ropes and gear and such. I have since brought it outside a few times to compare it to my Ophir 3 Slide and it hangs right there with, pun intended!

It is nice and thick and padded without being too heavy or bulky, with one exception as far as comfort... When the two ends of the waist belt come together as you cinch them they overlap and become a tad bulky with their thick padding, and at some angles while hanging or swinging it can press into your waist uncomfortably, but really not a huge issue.

That being said, after the break-in period it's very comfy to climb and work in! I took several decent whips on it in the gym, both intentional and otherwise lol, before taking it outside, and it's like falling on a cloud. Definitely a little more comfortable than the Ophir 3 Slide, although potentially not as rugged. I need some more time in it to consider replacing that workhorse.

The only other downside for me would be the gear loops, primarily the smaller rear ones since the new front plastic ones are huuuge lol. They are a little thin and placed mind of far back, and also sit pretty flat against the harness so they can can be a little difficult to find and clip if you don't already have something hanging on them. Like I said initially I know it's an alpine harness and that's the reason for the redesign of the loops, but like the waist belt it's really not a huge issue. Maybe an area for improvement on future models? Until then it will be hanging in my work locker as my day-to-day
review.name: Beautiful and comfortable harness!

name: Togir 3 Slide Harness

hasVariant.name: Stash Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Jetboil Stash Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It’s a great stove for a couple people but I wish it was self lighting. I used it camping and it was in the low 30’s and it went out a couple times.

I bought two of these stash. Cook sets one for myself and one for my sister. My sister had experienced a really bad storm in DFW without power so I sent her one of these so she could make lentils and rice. It came in clutch! 

The second use case I have for it is… I feed my dog, the honest kitchen brand food, which is basically freeze dried human grade, but in powder form. You basically mix it up with hot water and make a nice thick porridge. I keep one in my truck so that I could quickly heat up or barely warm up the water to make a hot meal for my coco pup basically anywhere we are! 

Plug: i also own the 3 other JetBoils. The Genesis full system, micro mo and mini mo. Took the mini mo to Banff and made the Food-for-sole brand meals. It was amazing to have it take care of 6 people using it taking turns. We had our food and a gallon of water. Spent the entire day at lake lousie and kept everyone nourished. 

They all have a place in our camp setup.
review.name: #NoRagrats

review.reviewBody: Water starts boiling very quickly. Used to boiled water to make my coffee and heat my dehydrated food. Every efficient and light weight. Very sturdy build.
I needed a little stove to take camping. Ended up buying the new yeti cargo tots and this fits perfectly in drop in basket. Can even put a gas canister in it for storage. Everything worked out great.
review.name: Compact

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this stove for 3-season use backpacking: fast boil, fuel efficient, compact, durable. I boil in the morning for coffee and evening for dinner (and sometimes tea). No issues getting 7 days from a 110g canister (helps to use a windbreak and to warm up the canister in my quilt in the morning). Probably not a beginner’s stove, but easy to set up and break down.
review.name: 3-Season efficiency for one person

review.reviewBody: I got this for Christmas of 2022 on my latest hike it stopped working but when I called jet boil they were very helpful and are going to replace it free of charge awesome product and service
review.name: Awesome service and product

review.reviewBody: I enjoy making coffee with my aeropress. With the jetboil stash im able to take my aeropress with me and make an amazing cup of coffee in only a few minutes wherever I choose whether that be at a campsite or the top of a mountain. In addition to the ability to make my coffee when I go hiking, the stash also allows me to boil water for freeze dried meals when I’m on particularly longer hikes. It condenses into a small footprint which allows for compact storage in a rucksack as well as organization as all its contents are contained in the vessel itself.
Efficient with fuel and time. Compact design. Good for any kind of camping or traveling
review.name: Quick and easy

review.reviewBody: I like it but the lid is far from perfect.  Be nice if that was addressed.
review.name: Okay but

review.reviewBody: JetBoils operate beautifully, but at 7 oz capacity it barely makes a reasonable cappuccino.
review.name: Fine operation but limited capacity

review.reviewBody: The backpack was a gift for our son-in-law. He was very happy to receive it
review.name: The backpack was a gift

review.reviewBody: We have 3 young children and our previous backpack diaper bag was not strong or large enough to handle all our diapers, wipes, clothing changes, and food/drink needs. Enter the Chiquillo 30L backpack - cada dia. This thing is strong and so spacious/expandable. Some diaper bags aren't supportive or the closures are weak. This bag allows for good support for long hikes and trips while allowing me to just throw it in the van not worrying if everything is going to spill out. It also seems like it will be a cinch to clean and is water resistant. It's not the typical diaper bag, but I find it to fit the bill better than a lot of other bags on the market. Functional and really lovely looking. I'm not like those other moms. I'm a cool mom.
review.name: Cotopaxi backpack for parenting win'

review.reviewBody: Having four young kids, I’ve gone through a log of diaper bags, many that are impractical. I spotted this backpack in and crowd and I decided I wanted to try it. This is it! Durability & flexibility for whatever I’m carrying around for the day to include my giant, awkward & heavy water bottle for all of us. It lightens my load daily so I can have my hard free to wrangle my kids. I love the easy access pockets, the color so the kids can spot me easily and how light but strong the material is. I even think it will clean up well and stay looking nice for years to come.
review.name: Eye catching

review.reviewBody: Perfect daily bag for work. Comfortable fit and plenty of space.
review.name: So many pockets!

review.reviewBody: Awesome backpack! Good for school, everyday, and travel! Very comfortable to wear and hold a lot!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ended up having to return this tent. The rain fly repeatedly got stuck in the zipper every time I zipped or unzipped it to enter or exit the tent. I didn't want to be constantly pulling the fly out the of the zipper and ultimately damaging the fly and zipper every time. This tent would benefit from better design to prevent this issue.
review.name: Design flaw- fly repeatedly gets caught in zipper
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our Catalyst 2-Person Tent (2023) product. We truly appreciate you bringing the zipper matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing some issues with our product.

We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

Additionally, in order to get repair assessment or advice, please fill out a Warranty Claim on our website under:

https://www.marmot.com/warranty-repair.html

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Easy setup, good seams, just over 5 lb total.  It’s a great tent
review.name: Better than the Aspen 2P

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This tent was perfect for my solo glamping trip to Yosemite. Setup was easy and the color coded tabs were helpful. I liked the two vestibules and apprecited the included footprint. A couple more stakes would have been handy.
review.name: Well considered little tent!

review.reviewBody: I carried this tent on my 3 day Pemi loop trek. Stayed two nights prior in it camping with my finance. The tent seems to be the perfect size for 1-2p without too much stuff. Kept dry, super easy to set up, especially by yourself with only a headlamp.  I’d recommend something lighter for true backpacking trips, but, if you have claustrophobia issues, this tent offers plenty of room, and might be worth the 6lbs (with poles on my scale) for comfort. I’m using this as our main tent for treks less than 40 miles til I can afford something as quality but lighter.
review.name: Great. Especially for price.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Although we haven't yet been on a backpacking trip, we tried it out in an overnighter, in our backyard. We had ample room for our packs, both in the tent and the vestibule. I love the pockets and the center hook for hanging our light. I think I'll enjoy it. The rain cover was fine
review.name: I think I'll keep it

review.reviewBody: Bought this tent for regular car camping excursions for year round recreation in New Mexico. Have used it once for 3 day outing in Jemez Mts during which time it rained for several hours one afternoon. Tent and fly kept me completely dry. Quality zippers all around. I like the roominess & extra headspace this tent provides. 3 interior pockets allow for organization of gear. The extra height & width of the larger door make it easy to get in and out of the tent. A bit heavy for bikepacking these days of ultra lightweight gear but for car camping this tent meets all my needs. The bright orange fly makes it easy to spot too. Enough room for 2, for solo camping it’s luxurious.
review.name: Great car camping tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The catalyst is a solid tent that offers plenty of covered space. Well constructed and is worth the little bit of extra weight it carries. One downside is does not come with enough stakes
review.name: Solid Tent

review.reviewBody: I really enjoyed this tent from the time I set it up in the house to my first camping trip with it. Easy to set up and I like the different ways you can configure the rain fly and vestibules. Thanks for the footprint too! I can see this tent being very warm and lacks some ventilation options other than the vestibules, the roll back option of the rain fly was nice and certainly let in much needed fresh air but there's no other ventilation available. Overall a great tent to get myself back into the outdoors, looking forward to using it more.
review.name: Great functioning tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We bought our first Catalyst 2 person tent in 2018 for our son's scout campouts.  He has used the tent 5-6 times per year since.  It's been perfect for him and his fellow scouts to share for several years now.  When our daughter recently needed a tent of her own, it was an easy decision for us to buy another Catalyst 2.  I'm sure we'll have similar success with this one.
review.name: Works So Well, We Bought Another One!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My daughter and I have taken our tent to the Grand Canyon and Superior Hiking Trail multiple times.  It's light weight, keeps you dry and easy to put up.
review.name: Great tent for hiking and camping!

name: Catalyst Tent: 2-Person 3-Season
