hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Technician Harness - Women's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Like this new option but still wish the Momentum came with a haul loop as liked the comfy material on that one. This one at least has a back loop though it's thin.
review.name: BD Trad Harness

review.reviewBody: This is my first harness and I wanted an all around one to fit any type of climbing I want to do. I barely feel it when I have all my gear and quickdraws attached to the harness and it fit nicely over any layers I decide to wear. I recently used it outdoors and for a lead climbing class and it feels very secure and comfortable on the climb. The only thing I would say is that lowering in the harness can be a bit uncomfotable for your inner thighs if you tend to have bigger thighs. There is less padding than other harnesses to allow for the lightweight comfortable fit. But overall it is a decent sacrifice for the overall functionality of the harness as a whole. I would definitely buy another.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: I bought this harness to kind of be my all around harness. I like that it has ice clipper slots and is super lightweight. I also appreciate the fifth gear loop, as a dude who enjoys multipitch trad climbing! Now on to the issues I have with it. I wish the gear loops were bigger, to accommodate more gear. I like to be able to fit at least a full rack, .3-3, on each loop and I struggle to fit it all on these gear loops. The bigger issue I have with it after a few months of use is that the leg loops seems to roll up when I sit in the harness for a while. I appreciate that the harness is lightweight, but the lack of padding also means lack of structure/integrity in the leg loops which allows it to roll up the legs while weighting it. Other than the rolling, which is pretty painful, the harness is quite comfortable to climb in. It’s also worth noting that my belay loop is starting to show a significant amount of wear and I’ve only had the harness for 6 months. While I do use it regularly (at least 1-2x/week), I wasn’t expecting the belay loop to wear down so quickly. It’s an okay harness, but nothing to write home about, for sure. I’d recommend looking elsewhere for a comfy all around harness.
review.name: Okay overall harness, couple big issues

review.reviewBody: So far it has been used mostly for indoor climbing with one week of outdoor clmbing. Plenty of gear loops, adjustability is good and the harness padding is comfortable.
review.name: Great fit, works well for indoor and outdoor sport climbing.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this harness back in 2018 prior to going ice climbing for the first time, I haven't found one I like nearly as much since. For a lightweight harness; it's well padded, durable, packs super small, has all the gear loops I need and I LOVE the fifth gear loop. When I'm trad or multi-pitch climbing I really appreciated that added organization. 
Detachable leg loops are also another thing I like about this harness, as I see a lot of lighter weight harnesses relying on elastic non-adjustable. The detachable feature gives more options for bathroom use and layering more comfortably when on longer/alpine style routes.
review.name: Love this harness!

review.reviewBody: Great harness, very comfortable! Love that adjustable leg loops are put on a harness that's still lightweight and very packable. Material is much thinner than the baseline momentum harness- but still very comfortable. Sometimes feel that BD gear loops could be slightly more 3D and pop out a bit (sometimes end up clipping my shirt in with the gear because of space) but not a gripe at all. Still my favorite harness to date.
Harness is lightweight and comfortable! Like that it has clipper compatibility, can't wait for ice season :)
review.name: Great fit!

review.reviewBody: This harness is designed to be used for rock climbing or ice climbing, and as such does not absorb water. If you will be doing hanging belays or whipping a lot, you might want something with more padding. I find that padding gets stinky during gym sessions, and I hate when my harness is wet from sweat, so I use this as an all-around harness. The gear loops are adequate, the leg loops are adjustable. I wish it had two buckles to more easily center the tie-in point, but you can't have everything.
review.name: Solid harness;

review.reviewBody: There isn't any one specific part of this harness that makes it so uncomfortable, it just is. It's too stiff and lacks good padding, it's stiff.. I just generally find it really unpleasant to wear.
review.name: Uncomfortable

description: Buy the TFO Axiom 2-X Rod + Case - 4 Piece online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Axiom 2-X Rod + Case - 4 Piece
hasVariant.description: Buy the TFO Axiom 2-X Rod + Case - 4 Piece online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have been super pleased with this thing over the last year, and it has outdone every expectation I had for it. 

I bought this as a salt-ready 6wt, that I can pack for some light flats fishing, knowing that I can strap this to my carry-on and not worry about it getting bounced around or beaten up. I ended up packing this to almost every Idaho/Wyoming trip I have been on, and fish this as a big bug rod for trout. 

Big heavy nymph rigs, streamers, chubbies and salmonflies; this thing has the backbone to throw the big stuff, while not skimping on the touch and feel that you need to make those long delicate casts to picky fish. Salt-ready features mean I don't have to worry as much about washing this thing off after every use (because come on, we are all lazy at the end of a fishing trip, let's be real).

Overall, this thing is a beast. Get one. You'll enjoy it.
review.name: Best Value Do It All Rod

name: Axiom 2-X Rod + Case - 4 Piece

review.reviewBody: Sturdy, well made boot. Has great arch support and could wear these all day!
review.name: Chelsea Boot

review.reviewBody:
Overall, I like these boots. You always take a gamble when you purchase shoes online, but these have worked out pretty well so far.

I will echo the concern others have about these boots being very roomy, to the point of having your heels slip inside of them. I made the mistake of ordering a half size up, which I’m sure did not help (my rationale was I did not want the boots to feel too tight while wearing thick winter socks). Stick to your size! These boots are roomy as is.

In order to fix the heel slip I added a thin insole underneath the stock insole, and added some adhesive heel pads to the inside of the shoe. They took a few days to break in but now are pretty comfortable. They look and feel high quality, repel water as advertised, and have fantastic tread. The tread is one of my main reasons for wanting these, and I’ve had no problem walking through snowy parking lots in these. 

I wanted something cute and more “grown up” than my sneakers, and these fit the bill. I hope they last a long time!
review.name: Very roomy - stay true to size!
comment: Thanks for the stellar feedback Alli!

review.reviewBody: A darling Chelsea boot! It was perfect for our trip to Europe in December where we did lots of walking and traveling by train. I couldn’t be more pleased!
review.name: A darling Chelsea boot!

review.reviewBody: These were returned due to them being too "purple" for me.
review.name: Pretty but the color is not for me.

review.reviewBody: The Fields Chelsea Waterproof boot is amazing. They are very comfortable, no break-in time and cute. I bought these before a trip to New York and I wore them everyday walking everywhere! I am also a high school teacher and they look and feel great for school, as well. have gotten several complements and may get the brown, too!! They are true to size!
review.name: Chelsea Boots are fabulous!

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and dry, i ordered a half size up and didn't need to, but have plenty of room for thicker socks if needed
review.name: Stylish and warm

review.reviewBody: Boots are well made and very cute. Arch support is good but not great for my feet. I can wear them around the office or out for short times but my arches started to hurt after a longer period of walking for a couple hours. I have very particular arch support needs that Chaco sandals are perfect for. They are otherwise reasonably comfortable for boots. Because I was hoping to have a shoe I didn't need to wear orthotics with, I probably wouldn't buy them again. But they could be fine for someone with less arch support issues. I'm typically 7.5 but 7 fit better.
review.name: Not bad

review.reviewBody: I get SO many compliments on these boots! They’re comfortable, warm without being hot, and absolutely waterproof. Great for fashion and function!
review.name: So many compliments!

review.reviewBody: I loved the boots in the photos but didnt like them at all after i got them. They remind me of rainboots, but not only that they rub my toes and unfortunately i cant return them. I have many pairs of different chacos from sandals, boots, and shoes…i love them all, but these boots are a hard no for me.
review.name: It’s a no for me!
comment: We appreciate your feedback Kari. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Very high arch that goes all the way to the outside of the foot so it feels like you’re stepping on something hard in your shoe. Also I wear a 8.5 but this is a half size too big. I have a pair of Chaco sandals I love and took a chance on an item they are not accepting returns for.
review.name: Uncomfortable insole
comment: We are sorry to hear that and would like to help in any way we can. Please give our customer service team a call at 888.211.1908.

name: Fields Chelsea Waterproof Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I Love This Boot!!! It's Durable, Warm, True To Size, & Great For The Inclement Weather...
review.name: Best Decision I've Made For Winter Footwear...

review.reviewBody: They're really cute and stylish but quite heavy, I tumbled down the stairs while wearing these because I suddenly lost my ability to walk. Would buy again.
review.name: Really cute

review.reviewBody: Excellent choice of BOOT and when I rec'd them, I was OVERJOYED. Ordered regular size and it's a GREAT fit. These boots are not a tight, uncomfortable nor narrow. They are very WARM, FUZZY, and with a STRONG structural built. Not to mention they are Attractive, STYLISH, & FUN!!
review.name: Awesome Boot; Two Thumps up!

review.reviewBody: I'm a size 12 so these already bulky boots look huge on me. However, I've worn them out in snow and freezing temps and my feet have been warm and dry. I needed boots that could withstand this weather and these certainly do the trick. One thing I'll note, one boot felt like it was too tight at first but I realized after I slip my foot in I need to readjust my heel and then it fits really comfortably like a glove.
review.name: Very bulky but they get the job done

review.reviewBody: I feel like i can literally wear these anywhere because they r so comfy. I use them for literally everything school, concerts, hiking and skiing. They keep me warm and are adorable .
review.name: Love these are so cute and perfect

review.reviewBody: I have a larger boot in the style. Love the quality and warmth of these boots. Don't like my feet cold and I bought these boots for when I'm out during the day to keep my feet warm in the winter time.
review.name: Perfect for the season.

review.reviewBody: Was confused about size, but it was feet perfectly.
review.name: I love it

review.reviewBody: I loved how warm they are, I am mexican so I'm not used to the cold weather of Alberta, Canada and these boots kept me warm in the days I went out to enjoy the snow. Only 2 things to beware of: they are very heavy (might be obvious but worth mentioning), and they're just a little bit big, I might have gone 1/2 size down.
review.name: Warm enough for Canadian winters

review.reviewBody: I love this boot! As usual, I wear an 11 but wear the Adirondack and Adiroam in 12s. I wore them on a very cold night, with wind chills. I felt great and looked cute at the same time!
review.name: so cute and warm

review.reviewBody: I bought the white ones for a recent ski trip that required lots of walking around town off mountain. I wore them for four days for about 7 hours each day and was really comfy. Highly recommend. I ordered a half size up because I have wide feet and wanted to wear fluffy socks.
review.name: obsessed

name: Adiroam Hiker Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I was really looking forward to running in the Skyward X. When I finally received them I was amazed at just how tall they were. They take maximal to new heights, almost cartoonish to be completely honest. I took them on several runs from shorter recovery runs to long distance runs of 30K, 22 and 24 miles. These shoes felt stiff underfoot. I was expecting for cloud like cushioning with that tall stack height but it didn't feel soft at all. Initially I thought maybe it they just needed to be broken in, but after a 100 miles they didn't soften up much. On longer runs they left my feet feeling tender to painful that other carbon plated super trainers never feel. (For reference I train in the NB FC SC Trainers v2 & v3 as well as the NB FC SC Pacers v2 for speed work and shorter races). These do feel better for walking and I retired these to walking shoe status, as they simply did not work for my runs. The Mach X 2 are a much better running shoe and highly recommend those for those looking for a HOKA Super Trainer.
review.name: Heavy & Clunky

review.reviewBody: It's so beautiful so so colorful and then you step in them and OM the most cushiony, cushioned comfort ever. I have pain in my feet every day so I thought oh boy, maybe not so much pain with these wide, comfortable shoes and yes!! comfortable? Are they ever!!! Please give them a try.
review.name: This shoe is so very comfortable it's unbelievable

review.reviewBody: I really, really wanted these to work! But they were just to tight in the mid foot to use and caused pain. There isn't any bounce either, so I would wait for the mach x 2 to get fixed hopefully instead.
review.name: Needs a Wide Size

review.reviewBody: Most shoes after a long day end up, giving you pains on your feet not these shoes. HOKA is the best and thank you for a great product. Everywhere I go I recommend them proudly
review.name: I love this Shoe most comfortable shoe I've ever bought

review.reviewBody: As a longtime fan of the Bondi line, I was excited to try these. With even more support, I expected even more comfort. Unfortunately for me, the added cushion resulted in less stability in my ankles. I could myself actively trying to maintain a proper step. I also found the size of the shoe to cause a greater chance of getting caught on uneven pavement, etc. Planning to send mine back.
review.name: Unstable, painful, not ready for prime time.

review.reviewBody: Love the bounce, which is what I expected and was not disappointed, but the colors leave a lot to be desired, so waited until black was released. However, black with neon orange laces was way too Halloweeny for me, so had to put in black laces, which really helped. Non-wide size would also be nice.
review.name: Change the laces to tone down clown car colors

review.reviewBody: This is by far the best and most comfortable shoe i have ever worn.
review.name: So, good, I bought 2 more pairs.

review.reviewBody: These shoes are fabulously comfortable. I can walk long distances with no discomfort. They are best for even rather than rough terrain, but most of my extensive walking is on smooth paths or pavement. I like the combination of black, which doesn't show the effects of kicking up dust, and the neon laces and highlights for visibility and pizzazz. I am a woman who was able to get the color and wider width I want by choosing a man's style. You might consider making this shoe in wide and offering dark colors in your selection for women.
review.name: Wonderful shoes!

review.reviewBody: Very happy to see the new colors on offer, they are bright and vibrant. Shoes fit true-to-size and are comfortable. Had difficulty breaking them in, but after multiple 10+ mile runs they are reactive and very fun to wear! Long time Hoka wearer (Cliftons) would definitely recommend.
review.name: Hard to break in, but AWESOME

review.reviewBody: Most comfortable shoe I have ever had. I walk 100 - 120 miles per week and my feet feel great in these shoes. I would highly recommend!
review.name: So good I bought a second pair in a different color

name: Skyward X Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Teva Ellewood in Pebble for a more casual shoe and for doing a lot of walking when traveling. The neutral color goes with about anything and they are comfortable from the first time I put them on. I have bought many different styles over the years and they never disappoint !
review.name: Love my Teva's!

review.reviewBody: So comfortable right out of the box! Well made and trendy, too!
review.name: Lovin' Tevas

review.reviewBody: I haven't had them long but they are great! They're comfortable to wear on hikes and long walks. I wear these shoes when I bike to classes and they are comfortable to wear on campus all day. The only thing I don't like is the laces are thin, I've never had shoes with such thin laces.
review.name: Love these shoes

review.reviewBody: Nice wide base provides good stability, immediately comfortable out of the box. May need inserts if you have high arches, little to no arch support in sole
review.name: Great shoe for work and home

review.reviewBody: Women's olive, size 10.5. Could wear without socks (but enough room for ankle socks). No rubbing.A miracle. Toe box is good. Lighter than a regular sneaker but still sturdy enough for walking. Have not worn in the rain (colors could bleed as per insert in shoebox). Not sure how they will fare in rainy weather...always leary of slippery soles. Wish they came in darker colors like navy or black (city dweller so darker colors don't look dirty). There is some padding...true test was that my hip didn't hurt after long walk. Not sure if I will add inserts. I tend not to give 5⭐️ unless I've had products for awhile-however I would definitely buy it again if in navy or black.
review.name: Would purchase again if in navy & size 10.5

review.reviewBody: I was hoping that this shoe would fit as well as the sandals, but it doesn't. At for me. They should be comfortable. They look nice, they're roomy enough not to aggravate my bunions. My feet just don't like them. The arch doesn't feel right. Nothing feels right. My feet wallow in them. The size it right. They just don't work for me. I hope I can send them back.
review.name: No

review.reviewBody: Knee warmers drive me nuts, so I was looking for a better option for those in-between days where I didn't want my full length thermal tights but also wasn't ready for just bib shorts. These do the trick without having to fuss with knee warmer placement. These aren't the top of the line Castelli but they definitely do the job.
review.name: Better than layering knee warmers

review.reviewBody: These fit great. They are the perfect balance between warm and cold.
review.name: Best for the buck

review.reviewBody:
5'8" at 161 lbs. Purchased size L. 
Happy with the fit. It's snug without struggling to get it on.
review.name: Usual one size up for Castelli

review.reviewBody: I have bought these twice before and liked them a lot. Bought another pair Dec 2022 and one leg was 2 inches shorter than the other.  Also the material was thinner and not so good for the 47º temperatures. Check them carefully before you go on a ride.
review.name: Defective

review.reviewBody: have a pair of Medium Castelli thermal long pants that fit perfect 5'7 145lbs. these knickers were wayyy too tight. gave them to my wife who is an xs in most clothing.
review.name: runs too small

review.reviewBody: They run a bit tight, but once you wear them for a bit they become even more comfortable. At first, I thought they were a bit tight but once on the bike and pedaling on and off the saddle, I found that these do not move around making the chamois stable during rides. Highly recommended!
review.name: Awesome feel, fit, and comfort!

review.reviewBody: Love these bib tights!!!! Premium feel and great comfort both tights and chamois. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great fit and quality

review.reviewBody: I was a bit unconvinced by "boiled merino wool" as a fabric. But it's great. As a knit it's not 100% wind stopping but it's pretty good. I've used it shoveling snow at 18F and windy. The gusts of wind were a bit noticeable but my head stayed warm and dry. When I got inside I was surprised to find the cap was covered in snow and a bit wet but it completely protected my head. As to it being snug- I wear a 59-cm hat (slightly larger as I have to stretch them a tad) and it is snug but not tight on me. It also loosened up just a tad or I just got used to it. I would NOT classify it as tight for a beanie/watch-cap which are supposed to be snug.
review.name: Warm, keeps the snow off.

name: Boiled Wool Beanie

review.reviewBody: Very happy with these mountain biking shorts. Fit is comfortable over my PI chamois. Love the 1" waist size increments! I'm a 31 and you just don't see that with other brands. Stylish enough to wear out after your ride. Looking seriously at the Ride pants now that it's getting cooler.
review.name: Excellent riding shorts

review.reviewBody:
I recently picked up the Outdoor Research Men's Freewheel Ride Shorts, and I’m really impressed! They’re super lightweight and dry quickly, which is a big plus when I’m out biking on warm days. The fabric stretches nicely, so I don’t feel restricted at all while pedaling.

I love the pockets—there’s one that zips, which is great for keeping my phone secure. They look good enough to wear off the bike too, so I can easily go from the trail to grabbing lunch. Overall, these shorts are comfy and practical, and I’d definitely recommend them if you’re looking for something versatile!
review.name: Awesome shorts for MTB

review.reviewBody: Mountain Biking - these shorts are the best I've found so far. Great fit, great pockets for Iphone (a must for me) adjustable and comfortable. Bought two different colours and rode with them 1st time today. Had to wait for the Canadian store to get them but worth it!
review.name: Love these shorts - worth the wait

review.reviewBody: great mtb shorts, I'm very happy OR is making mtb gear. These are my go-to, but I would like to see hand pockets in the next version. These work great while riding, but before & after riding you need to stuff everything in the thigh pockets (wallet, keys, phone, etc.), which is awkward and makes them swing like crazy with every step. I'm never going to race, so I'm happy to have the extra weight of hand pockets.
review.name: wish they had hand pockets

review.reviewBody: I wish these shorts had regular hand pockets as well. I would give it a 5 if it did. I often find myself trying to put stuff in where I think hand pockets are. Size is true to size. Perfect length to prevent knee pad gap.
review.name: Review

review.reviewBody: These are my favorites! Just finished a 4 day trip Mtb trip to Quebec. I wore these day 2 , then realized I only wanted to wear these for the next 2 days. I washed them , wore them and loved them. Waist band sinched up perfectly and comfortably. I forgot that I had my phone in the pocket, because it is so well placed . Perfect fit me!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Time for a ten ride review! These shorts have all the right features I'm looking for in a bike short. Great material - stretchy yet durable. Great fit - right length, true to size waist with great adjustability (no belt needed) and they fit perfect in the crotch (doesn't get caught on seat). I wear these over a PI liner short and they've quickly become my all time favorites! I've ridden for for over 30 years and used many brands of shorts - these are winners! I've already bought a second pair. For reference I'm 64, 5'9" and 168 pounds. I wear 34" in everything Ferrosi and Method. These are 34".
review.name: All time favorite MTB shorts!

review.reviewBody: Loose enough for easy movement but tight enough not to bunch or snag. The phone pocket is just the right size where is ready to drop the phone in but not so large it flops around while riding. It's also located where you don't really feel it when pedaling. The new slide button closure is great, as long as you remember it's not a normal snap and try pulling it open. Overall really happy with them.
review.name: Excellent no nonsense riding shorts

review.reviewBody: The fit is spot on with a tailored fit and stretch in all the right places. I have been out on 10+ rides in the three weeks that I have had these shorts and I absolutely love them. The length is just right for them to sit nicely while pedaling. With the tighter fit I have not had any issues while transitioning in and out of the saddle. I love the T-snap and you don't notice it even on long rides. I love these as a riding short and an everyday wear short. I will definitely be ordering another pair. Fit was true to size.
review.name: My new favorite pair of shorts

review.reviewBody: Great shorts to ride in so far. Comfortable and a chamois short fits underneath just fine. Great pockets and I like the button snap and draw strings. Good riding fit for enduro bros and Dads alike. My only gripe is the length. I'm almost 6'3" and they are long on me. This is a 32 waist as well. I like the vent on the backside.
review.name: Good short but too long

name: Freewheel Ride Short - Men's
Freewheel Ride Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: My favorite shirt for travel as it’s light and looks great even if you’ve had to sleep in it. Packs nicely and comes out looking ready for a night at the local watering hole.

review.reviewBody: Nice looking shirt. Had to get a tailor to greatly shorten the arms for a good fit( which is a problem with snaps instead of buttons).

One of the few shirts that are cut just right to fit my slim frame and with appropriate sleeve lengths. Most other brands offering similar shirts may fit me in the shoulders, but hang like billowing blouses with sleeves lengths two inches too long. Great, comfortable shirts. I now own four, and wear them year around.

description: Buy the MSR E-Bivy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: E-Bivy
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR E-Bivy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Does not stay dry inside, unfortunatly the first product from MSR that failed and I cannot recommand
review.name: Does not stay dry inside!

review.reviewBody:
Two days after receiving my E Bivy I went on a 10 day trip. 
First 5 nights it rained lightly every night and I stayed dry. 
Love the lightweight too. 
It lightened my sleep system by nearly 6 oz.
review.name: 5 nights of rain - stayed dry

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using this for winter camping. It is roomy enough to hold my big winter sleeping bag and a foam pad. It is very light and packs very small. It is a great addition to my winter kit.
review.name: Great for winter

review.reviewBody: No matter what I try, I can't seem to keep dry inside this bivy. Also, there's no way to tighten the hole around your face (presumably because wind blowing into it is the only way you might be able to minimize condensation). It really is just as good as a garbage bag. Way too expensive for what it is. But I guess I have it now, so I'll have to keep looking for ways to keep down the moisture.
review.name: Condensation Issues

review.reviewBody:
Condensation hits this bivy in no time and because there is no way of connecting a rope to it's opening, the whole Bivy just sticks to your face.
I can't imagine anyone enjoying this product. It is one of the worst equipment I have ever purchased.
I tried to use it for bikepacking - it is useless.
review.name: A real waste of money.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been guiding in Alaska now for quite some time. I purchased the e-bivy to use in conjunction with my UL floor less tent and it failed. Not once but multiple times I used it this fall. It takes no time for this bivy to become saturated by even the smallest bit of overnight condensation or snow drift that gets blown under the tent. Leaving my sleeping bag inoperable and putting me in a potentially dangerous situation. I do not recommend anyone use this bivy for any climate. Especially if you are in an emergency situation. The top loading vs side entry does not make this product any easier to use being 99% of all sleeping bags are side zip. Obviously MSR did not spend much time developing this poor excuse for a “shelter”.
review.name: A bivy that doesn’t keep you dry

review.reviewBody: Spent a night in a snow cave inside the E-bivy recently and it performed well. Just be careful to configure the opening so your exhalations vent out easily or you will get some condensation.
review.name: Light, packable and effective

review.reviewBody: Great peace of mind in a small package. I keep one of these in my pack on almost every outing, for the weight it is great insurance in case something goes wrong. Surprisingly light weight!
review.name: Great peace of mind in a small package.

review.reviewBody: I've used my eBivy on a few multi-day bikepacking trips with and without a poncho sil-tarp. For a quick and light set-up, it's ideal. If I keep my breath out, I've had no condensation problem and with a blanket and mattress very good sleeps. I use a micro-fiber liner I can pull over my head that allows breath to pass through but keeps the bugs out. If you're too rushed or lightweight to use a tent, this will work. Small, light and quick to use. Hard to beat that for a few hour nap.
review.name: Works for me.

name: E-Bivy

review.reviewBody:
Fits great, lightweight, and perfect for the those hot summer days. This pattern/color scheme is super cute on.
123# 5'3" and size small was perfect.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody:
Love the high neck, color block!!
Size Large- wear medium to large shirts- 8/10 or 36B Bra
review.name: Great cut, color block, and fit!

review.reviewBody: Love this Rashguard! It is comfortable and stylish.
review.name: Rashguard

review.reviewBody: I’ve had my eye on this rash guard for a while. I was drawn to the earthy colors, which are often harder to find. Many options for matching bottom colors too. I’m very glad I finally ordered one before they were gone!
review.name: Love the Colors and Fit

review.reviewBody: I am 5’6, 145 pounds. With broad shoulders. Sizing charts suggests small as did the fit tool. But the small fit tight across the chest and shoulders (some stretching across the zipper) whereas the medium fit just nicely. So if you want something to wear in the water small might be better as it will likely stretch out a bit when wet. If you want it as a sun shirt - Medium looks better.
review.name: Fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this happy print! I have another Kona Rashguard; this one has the sleeves in all one color which I prefer. I got the large since I wear large in the tankini; fits great and does the trick for a little extra warmth in the Pacific!
review.name: I love this happy print!

review.reviewBody: I like the quality and print of the Rashguard for my kayaking adventures!
review.name: Great quality

name: Kona Rashguard - Women's

hasVariant.name: Flyer Sleeping Pad

hasVariant.name: Flyer Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Flyer Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've used this pad for three week-long bikepacking trips where I was camping every night. I'm 6'0 175 lb and I got the long-wide, and really looked forward to sleeping every night; the extra sleeping area and warmth of this pad make for a great night's sleep.  It requires careful tight rolling, and is not tiny when rolled, but I'm prepared to carry a little more for the comfort it provides.  This was my first Nemo product, I was so impressed by its thoughtful design that I bought the Nemo Dragonfly Osmo tent.
review.name: Super comfy - worth the carry

review.reviewBody: Thank you to NEMO for thinking of the side sleepers!  This is a great pad for 3 season camping.  I also love that NEMO uses Bluesign materials as sustainability is a major factor for me when choosing outdoor gear.
review.name: Side Sleepers Unite

review.reviewBody: It you're looking for more comfort in the backcountry this pad will treat you well. It has the open-cell foam insulation along with the inflatable design and is still super light weight packed. It's also a quiet mat, there's no crunching to disturb your neighbor in the night. The air valve is also universal so can take any pump sack, otherwise a could pumps with your breath will do it or you can leave it open to slowly inflate itself.
review.name: Great Pad

name: Flyer Sleeping Pad

hasVariant.description: Buy the Evolv Kronos Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I got these shoes about a year ago for my move to Paris, France. Paris has some of the best climbing gyms in the world. Got to use this pair in both bouldering/top rope gyms and out bouldering in Fontainebleau. Never got any blisters. The shoes were a complete upgrade from my beginner shoes and totally changed the game. I would recommend these any day to anyone looking for more advanced shoes. Mine are still in great condition - no wear and tear yet. Highly highly recommend.
review.name: Great for indoor top rope

review.reviewBody: Great shoe for a casual climber, not too aggressive and perfect for weekend use. Comfortable!
review.name: Casual climber

review.reviewBody: This shoe has rubber everywhere making it easier to toe and heal hook. The only downside is that they aren’t they are not very breathable.
review.name: Tons of rubber

review.reviewBody: This shoe was great for my first climbing shoe. At that point of my climbing journey I wasn’t aware of shoe stretching and so after about 4 months they were too big. BUT, in the time I did wear them I loved them. They were comfy, sticky, and I loved the lacing system. You can get a really articulated fit. Great shoe for beginners or for someone who wants a quality shoe that’s comfy!
review.name: My first shoe

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, yet perform well. Not as aggressive as some shoes, but I'll sacrifice that for the comfort of my toes. If I need better performance for a specific boulder problem, I can easily change out shoes.
review.name: Great shoes!

review.reviewBody: Perfect

Fits great, feels great. The best non-aggressive shoe in my opinion. 

Sizing runs a little small... my street shoe is 10.5 (43.5) but I wear an 11 (44.5) for Kronos.
review.name: First rate beginner or intermediate shoe

review.reviewBody: The shoe fits great and seems to be holding up well so far. I have used them about 10-15 times bouldering indoors. I do recommend trying a few different sizes to get the right fit. The velcro straps are useful for quick and easy adjustments. They are a bit more stiff than my previous shoes, offering a bit more support on smaller footholds, but still flexible enough for some sensitivity and comfort. I personally cannot speak for professionals, but these shoes are great for beginner-moderately experienced climbers!
review.name: Great Shoe

review.reviewBody:
I normally wear size up due to my wide feet - 5.5 (m) /7.5 (w) - I had to size up 3 times > to 8 (m)/9 (w), so like 4 sizes up. What's up with this sizing? The length measurements are absolutely inaccurate. Very off.
Other then sizing, it's a comfortable shoe.
review.name: Runs extremely small

review.reviewBody: I’ve tried numerous shoes and this one was the most comfortable to me as a beginner climber. The shoes does run small to make them tight so remember to size up a full size if you want a more comfortable but snug fit.
review.name: Great beginner shoe.

name: Kronos Climbing Shoe

And we've been lifelong frequent travelers worldwide. The Osprey Sojourn Shuttle 130L is stellar. We've used many wheeled duffels on countless multi-month journeys to remote locations requiring numerous flights, and, in our opinion, this Osprey wheeled duffel is beyond compare. It's bigger, lighter, sturdier than others, and it's thoughtfully, cleverly designed to be as easy-to-use as possible.

description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Stuff Sack Pillow online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Stuff Sack Pillow
hasVariant.description: Buy the Therm-a-Rest Stuff Sack Pillow online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is not an ultra light pillow, but I was impressed. I did not slide off the pillow like others and it stayed in place. The size is not too small and felt like a real pillow. It is also not too big, as I do not bring a lot of clothes to stuff the pillow with. Would be nice if it came in different colors, as I imagine this will get dirty.
review.name: Feels like a good size Pillow

review.reviewBody: I really liked this but the top came apart from the lining after 19 days of use. I bought this to take to Europe to walk the Camino de Santiago. I left on May 1 and today is the 19th. I'm here for two months and it's falling apart. Very disappointed in the quality.
review.name: The top came apart from the lining after 19 days of use.

review.reviewBody: This is OK but synthetic fabric isn’t great in the heat. The original stuff sack pillow which was a bit furry was utterly perfect. Please make that type again. If I’d known you’d stop making them I would have bought one for all my hiking friends/family because they always try and steal mine.
review.name: This is OK but synthetic

review.reviewBody: This stuff sack makes a great pillow. I fill it with all my morning clothes, wake up and they are warm and ready to go.
review.name: Great camp pillow

review.reviewBody: Just used this stuff sack pillow for 4 nights to replace my inflatable pillow. I was very impressed -- a great improvement, and it's nice that one bag can be used 2 ways.
review.name: Very happy with this purchase

review.reviewBody: Replaced my old one, soft fuz on the inside makes a great pillow
review.name: Great pillow

review.reviewBody: Nice feel to the liner. The outer material is a little loud. Tough it is a versatile piece and will work in a pinch. Not sure it'll be my first choice but a solid backup option.
review.name: Nice Feel

review.reviewBody: I do love the dual functionality of this stuff sack as a compact pillow. It is a tad noisy when you're moving around on it-- I'd compare it to how a down comforter can be loud during adjustments. Overall, I like it!
review.name: Nice pillow/stuff sack

review.reviewBody: I purchased this product online and if I had seen it in the store in person, I probably would not have purchased it. Conceptually, I bought this to store my sleeping gear in my pack and to use (obviously) as a pillow at night. The design is great, The micro-fleece lining is great. The Cordura outer shell was a poor design choice. The fabric is ""crinkly"" and when being used as designed, it is very much like trying to sleep with your ear on a potato chip bag - not conducive to a restful night's sleep. It fails the ""user experience"" test in that way. I own other Therma-rest products which I've found to be wonderful and fit for use. This, however, is not on my list of items to recommend to others.
review.name: Was there any actual field testing?

review.reviewBody: This works great as a pillow when used with a nice fleece jacket inside or something similar. Its shape also lends itself well to being a great neck pillow for hammock sleeping. I highly recommend it.
review.name: Great Ultralight Pillow Option

name: Stuff Sack Pillow

review.reviewBody: Would buy these again and again, and recommend them for anyone that likes warm hands when they ski.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Really impressed with the warmth. I have a pair of Hestra gloves and needed a colder option. These are versatile and seem best 20-0 degrees Fahrenheit. The internal leash is very helpful on lifts and internal mitten liner is fantastic. Highly recommend. They tend to run a bit smaller.
review.name: Hestra Armys for the win

review.reviewBody: My Hestra Heli Mitten finally started to split at a seam after 15 years. Went for the Army Leather Gore-Tex Mitten while on sale. The new Mitten is warm just like the old one. I do use hand warmers and/or liners when the high temps are below 25F. My only minor complaint is I replaced a size 9 with a new size 9, but the new mitten seems slightly larger than the former.  All in all, very happy with the purchase and hope they last as long as the last pair.
review.name: Replacing 15 yr old Hestra Heli Mitten

review.reviewBody: Unlike the "heli" by hestra this doesn't have a removable liner.  As it goes, they seem extremely warm and I like the cuff.  It's just right to go over my ski coat sleeve but no let execess snow or wind in.  The grip is all good as well.  I haven't gotten them wet inside yet so I can't speak to that, but Hestra has a long line of strong reviews and this is no different.  My wife has the "heli" mitt and other than liner I can't really see a difference.  You don't notice the goretex.  If you ski a lot of colder snow conditions with frozen moisture, I'd actually recommend the Heli.  If you are more west coast with wetter conditions, I think the gore-tex pays.  IMHO.  I'm please though, didn't like the price, but love the product.
review.name: Hestra army leather gore-tex mitten

review.reviewBody: I have read lots of good things about these mitts so I purchased a pair.  The materials and constructions seem solid and they have good looks and features but I am not convinced the level of insulation on the back of the hands will be sufficient for the coldest days in Utah or Northern CA that are 15F-20F before high windchill.  They are significantly thinner compared to the Hestra Army Leather Extreme mittens.   I would have gone for the Extreme but they don't have Gore-tex waterproof protection.  The Gore-tex mittens are more similar to the Heli mittens in insulation thickness.
review.name: Seems good but insulation can be more?

review.reviewBody: I was on a lift at Snowbird complaining my frozen fingers and the guy next to me suggested Hestra goretex. Where have you been all these years, Hestra? (likely, me skimping on price, but never again!). These babies are warm, very warm, even in 10F and wind. Too hot for skinning up, but I keep them in my backpack for the way down.
review.name: best ski gloves ever

name: Army Leather GORE-TEX Mitten - Men's

I was so excited to find out that that wasn't the case. These shoes are freaking awesome! I used to wear skate shoes all the time growing up and these totally bring me back. And they aren't lying when they say that they stick to the pedals! BUY THESE SHOES! You won't be disappointed. Super comfy and can handle my total clumsiness. :)
review.name: Super comfy!!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Silca Nastro Piloti Bar Tape online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: A month ago, I wrapped the bars.  Nice look, good feel.  Decided to changed brake position and while carefully unwrapping - the adhesive strip stuck and the bar tape tore.  Can't use it again. One wrap product, will not buy again.
review.name: Doesn't rewrap

review.reviewBody: I recently wrapped my bars with this tape and agree with the other reviews that it is too short. Besides the length, the tacky feel and comfort are great. And it has some stretch so you can wrap it tightly, which is a must to cover an adequate amount on the bars. I don’t use finishing tape and wrap “backwards “ ending at the hole where I stuff the excess in and plug. I had to re-wrap a few times just to cover it all. And this was on 40cm bars. Just need 2-3” more to be great…
review.name: Really good with one drawback

review.reviewBody:
This is an initial review, I've only done about 600km riding since installing this tape.  This would get 5 stars if it was a bit longer by about 6 inches.  Yes, it's expensive but it is very easy to install and you can wrap it tight.  Way to early to comment on durability but I expect it to be very long lived.  The dual grip choice seems a good option, I wrapped on the max grip side and indeed the grip is excellent with sweaty hands or in the rain.  It is super comfortable and damps out vibration very well without loss of road feel.  Yes, it is thinner but I find the vibration damping and road feel to be far better than thicker tapes.

I'm very impressed with this tape, Silca seem to have done their homework well.  I really like it on my road bike and am about to put it on my gravel bike.  I've not used anything better, I also run Silca latex tubes and if the bar tape is as good as their tubes then I expect it will perform well for a good long time.
review.name: GREAT Bar Tape

review.reviewBody: The bar tape is very thin and not long enough for standard handle bars. I have the black inc bar stem combo and there is not enough length in the tape to wrap with a figure 8 around the hoods, with out a figure 8 there is still not enough to cover the bar adequately. I would not recommend
review.name: It's ok

name: Nastro Piloti Bar Tape
